Subject: RE: Rule 23 motion 
Date: Wed, 22 Jul 2020 22:21:29 +0000 
Attachments: 2020-07-22,GMJetter_to_Judge_Nathan_re_Local_Rule_23.1_v2.docx 
)" 
Very sorry for the delayâ€”I've lost count of how many times I've had to restart my computer today. Attached is the draft in 
its current form. 
From: (USANYS) 
<
Sent: Wednesday, July 22, 2020 6:18 PM 
To: 
Cc: (USANYS) 
) 
Subject: RE: Rule 23 motion 
Okay, thanks. On the draft, if someone could just send me whatever you have at whatever stage it is now, I'll take it from 
here as I really want to get this up to the Brass tonight. Thanks 
From: 
Sent: Wednesday, July 22, 2020 5:59 PM 
To: (USANYS) 
Cc: (USANYS) ; 
<i>; 
Subject: RE: Rule 23 motion 
Perfect, and I did -  I mentioned we'd be filing a response in the next day or so. 
From: (USANYS) 
<
Sent: Wednesday, July 22, 2020 17:57 
To: 
Cc: (USANYS) 
iS 
Subject: Re: Rule 23 motion 
>; 
I think no position is right, although I think you can tell him we plan to file something in response soon. Speaking of, what 
is the status of the draft? 
Sent from my iPhone 
On Jul 22, 2020, at 3:58 PM, wrote: 
Just FYI for everyone, Brad just called and asked if we had a view as to whether victims' counsel should file a response to 
the defense motion from last night. I said my assumption was that we had no position or view at all with respect to 
EFTA00032085

what victims' counsel should or should not do, and wouldn't direct victim counsel on something like that, but that I 
would let him know if that was incorrect. So please let me know if we should convey something else, and I'm happy to 
pass it along, otherwise I've conveyed our neutrality. 
Assistant U.S. Attorney 
Southern District of New York 
EFTA00032086
